Selected Answer: B
Identifying the role of IT in supporting the business is a foundational step in developing an effective IT governance model. This involves understanding how IT aligns with and contributes to the overall business strategy and objectives. By clarifying the role of IT, organizations can ensure that governance efforts are directly tied to business value and priorities. Starting with a clear understanding of the role of IT in supporting the business ensures that subsequent governance decisions and policies are aligned with the broader organizational goals. This strategic alignment is crucial for the success of the IT governance model.

comments.content:
By identifying the role of IT in supporting the business, the enterprise can clarify its expectations from IT, define key priorities, and establish the necessary structures and processes to ensure that IT resources are allocated effectively and IT initiatives are aligned with business goals.

Once the role of IT in supporting the business is clearly defined, the enterprise can then proceed to prioritize investments in IT (option A), define policies for data, applications, and organization of infrastructure (option C), and identify IT services that currently support the enterprise's capability (option D) in a more informed and strategic manner.

While evaluating return on investment (option A), managing the risk governance process (option B), and nominating IT steering committee membership (option D) are important aspects of IT governance, they are typically responsibilities that involve participation from various stakeholders within the organization, including the CEO, rather than being the primary role of the CEO in IT governance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Establishing enterprise strategic goals

The PRIMARY role of the CEO (Chief Executive Officer) in IT governance is to establish enterprise strategic goals. As the top executive responsible for the overall direction and performance of the organization, the CEO plays a pivotal role in setting the strategic direction that IT governance should align with.

Establishing enterprise strategic goals involves defining the overarching objectives, priorities, and initiatives that the organization aims to achieve. These strategic goals provide the framework within which IT governance decisions and investments are made to support and advance the organization's mission and vision.

Which of the following is a PRIMARY responsibility of the CIO when an enterprise plans to replace its enterprise resource applications?

choices.A: Ensuring IT architecture requirements are considered
choices.C: Determining critical success factors for related projects

discussion.content: C. Determining critical success factors for related projects

comments.content: A. Ensuring IT architecture requirements are considered

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When an enterprise plans to replace its enterprise resource applications, one of the PRIMARY responsibilities of the Chief Information Officer (CIO) is to ensure that IT architecture requirements are considered.

IT architecture encompasses the overall structure and design of an organization's information technology systems, including hardware, software, networks, data storage, and integration frameworks. It is crucial for the CIO to ensure that the replacement applications align with the existing IT architecture and strategic objectives of the organization.

By ensuring IT architecture requirements are considered during the replacement process, the CIO helps to ensure interoperability, scalability, security, and compliance with regulatory standards across the enterprise's IT landscape.

comments.content: While addressing required changes outside the business case (option A), identifying metrics post-implementation to measure project success (option C), and entering the business case into the enterprise architecture (option D) are important considerations in the business case methodology, updating the business case throughout its life cycle is fundamental to its effectiveness and relevance.

It would be most beneficial for an enterprise to include procedures for updating the business case throughout its life cycle when establishing a methodology for business cases.

Business cases are dynamic documents that should reflect changes in project scope, assumptions, risks, and benefits over time. By establishing procedures for updating the business case throughout its life cycle, the enterprise ensures that the document remains relevant, accurate, and aligned with the evolving needs and priorities of the organization.
